meanings.definition: Emit a long, wavering, high-pitched vocal sound resembling a howl with a trilling quality.
meanings.sent1: The women were ululating joyfully at the wedding.
meanings.sent2: The singer was ululating during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The ululating sound of the sirens added to the chaos of the scene.
meanings.sent4: The wind ululated through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The ululating cry of the wolf echoed through the night.

meanings.definition: Make a loud, high-pitched sound, typically in a rhythmic manner, as a form of expression or celebration.
meanings.sent1: The children were ululating with excitement at the party.
meanings.sent2: The crowd started ululating in unison at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The ululating of the car alarm woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The kettle on the stove began to ululate as it reached boiling point.
meanings.sent5: The ululating of the cicadas filled the summer evening with their song.
